Description: Wooden cosmetic-spoon; the handle is in the form of a dog which bites the tail of the fish that forms the bowl and the lid(now detached); blue painted detail.
Curator's comments: Published: D. Symons in: Man's Best Friend, Birmingham 1991, p.33 [96]. P. Kozloff, B. Bryan, and M. Berman, Egypt's Dazzling Sun, Cleveland 1992, pp.350-351 [77] = Le Pharaon-Soleil , Paris 1993, p.307 [77]. Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne, Saint-Gérard 1997, p.121 [85]. D. Antoine and M. Vandenbeusch, Egyptian mummies. Exploring ancient lives, Sydney 2016, pp. 132-3.
Exhibition history: 1991 8 Jan-24 Mar, Birmingham Museum and City Art Gallery, Man’s Best Friend 1992 Jul-Sep, Ohio, The Cleveland Museum of Art, Egypt's Dazzling Sun: Amenhotep III & his World 1992/3 Oct-Jan, Texas, Kimbell Art Museum, Egypt's Dazzling Sun: Amenhotep III & his World 1993 Mar-May, Paris, Grand Palais, Egypt's Dazzling Sun: Amenhotep III & his World 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens Commoners of the New Kingdom 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2004 10 Jul-4 Sept, Bolton Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2004 18 Sept-14 Nov, Salford Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2004-2005 27 Nov-23 Jan, Chester, Grosvenor Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2005 5 Feb-28 May, Warrington Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2005 18 Jun-18 Sept, Rochdale Art Gallery, Beasts of the Nile 2005 26 Sept-2 Dec, Preston, Museum of Lancashire, Beasts of the Nile 2006 14 Jan-22 Apr, Lancaster City Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2006 9 May-6 Aug, Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2006 14 Aug-19 Nov, Swansea Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2011 27th June -
